title: Question 17
prompt: Is this bar graph a valid depiction of China’s unemployment for 2003–2004?
description:
Click the one best answer to each question.

According to the CIA’s website, an official Chinese journal estimated overall unemployment (including rural areas) for 2003 at 20%. The CIA’s website also reports the official registered unemployment in urban areas of China in 2004 as 9%.
feedback:
Answer Explanation: The two bars represent two different kinds of information. The 2003 bar represents overall unemployment, including rural areas. The 2004 bar represents only official registered unemployment in urban areas. A graph should not compare overall unemployment to only urban unemployment.

According to the CIA’s website, an official Chinese journal estimated overall unemployment (including rural areas) for 2003 at 20%. The CIA’s website also reports the official registered unemployment in urban areas of China in 2004 as 9%.
